description:
Shorefield is a characterful eco-house in Bruichladdich on the Isle of Islay, Scotland, sleeping 6 guests in 3 bedrooms. This well-insulated property runs on its own wind and solar power, making it perfect for eco-conscious travelers and nature enthusiasts visiting the Scottish Islands.

The house is owned by an elderly couple who are passionate bird lovers, and their enthusiasm is reflected throughout the property. The garden includes private woodland, ponds, and bird reserves created by the owners, offering exceptional opportunities for bird watching and nature observation. The property retains its quaint, quirky charm with original paintings, maps, antiques, books, and stories throughout - perfect for those seeking character over modern minimalism.

The accommodation features a large kitchen table for 6, separate dining room also seating 6, wood-burning stove, and selection of books and games. Wifi is available throughout. The property has 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Please note there is no dishwasher, but washing machine and dryer are provided. Bruichladdich Distillery is a 10-minute walk along the coastal cycle path, while swimming beaches are easily accessible. Port Charlotte's restaurants, pubs, and shops are 5 minutes by car or 45 minutes via the scenic cycle path. Dogs welcome at £15 per stay. Ideal for nature lovers, bird watchers, and visitors seeking an authentic, eco-friendly Isle of Islay experience.

description:
Portbahn House is a modern, spacious self-catering holiday home in Bruichladdich on the Isle of Islay, Scotland, sleeping 8 guests in 3 bedrooms. It's perfect for whisky enthusiasts visiting the world-famous single malt distilleries and families with children seeking adventure on the Scottish Islands, this well-insulated property sits along the shoreline of Loch Indaal with stunning sea views. 

The contemporary open-plan design features a fully equipped kitchen, dining area for 8, lounge with wood-burning stove, and conservatory - ideal for groups enjoying Islay's renowned whisky tours or families gathering after days exploring beaches and coastal walks.

The ground floor accommodation sleeps 8 guests across three bedrooms: a master bedroom with super king and single bed (sleeps 3) plus ensuite bathroom, a triple bedroom with double and single bed (sleeps 3), and a twin bedroom with two single beds (sleeps 2). A family bathroom and additional upstairs toilet provide convenience for larger groups and families. The spacious kitchen comes fully equipped with dishwasher, microwave, oven, refrigerator, and dining table seating 8 comfortably. Entertainment includes TV with Freesat, DVD player, extensive selection of DVDs, books and games, plus WiFi throughout - perfect for relaxing evenings after distillery visits or beach adventures.

Outside, the large private mature garden offers uninterrupted sea views across Loch Indaal plus exceptional features for families: a sunken trampoline and swings that children love, alongside BBQ facilities for summer evenings. Underfloor heating throughout and a cosy wood-burning stove ensure year-round comfort whether you're visiting for winter whisky tours or summer beach holidays. Ample parking within the property grounds accommodates multiple vehicles - essential for whisky touring groups. Dogs are welcome at £15 per stay, making this the perfect base for families exploring Islay with their four-legged companions.

Bruichladdich Distillery, producing world-famous single malt whisky and The Botanist gin, is just a 10-minute walk along the coastal cycle path - ideal for whisky enthusiasts who can walk home after tastings. Portbahn Beach, one of Islay's hidden treasures with three beautiful bays perfect for families, sits just 5 minutes' walk away for wild swimming, beachcombing, and coastal exploration. 

The Bruichladdich Mini Market village shop, run by Aileen, serves excellent coffee, toasties, and sandwiches - open 9am-6pm and only 10 minutes' walk. Port Charlotte, featuring family-friendly restaurants, traditional pubs, Islay Museum, and sandy harbour beach, is 5 minutes by car or 20 minutes on foot via the scenic coastal path. With the largest capacity of our three properties and both whisky tourism and family activities literally on your doorstep, Portbahn House is the perfect Islay base for distillery tours, beach days, and Scottish Islands adventures.

description:
Curlew Cottage is a characterful holiday cottage in Bruichladdich on the Isle of Islay, sleeping 6 guests in 3 bedrooms. Situated on an elevated position between Bruichladdich and Port Charlotte, the cottage enjoys a private access road shared only with two neighboring homes, creating a very safe environment for families with children to enjoy the gardens.

The ground floor features a large dining/family room, sitting room with wood-burning stove, fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher and microwave, and laundry room with washing machine, tumble dryer, and airing pulley. The main bathroom includes both bath and shower. Upstairs, two bedrooms share the landing, while a third bedroom is accessed via a separate stair and has its own small ensuite bathroom.

The cottage has oil-fired central heating, double glazing throughout, and a cosy wood-burning stove making this an ideal year-round retreat for families visiting the Scottish Islands. Broadband wifi is available. Outside, the walled rear garden includes a greenhouse and garage, created from former farm steading buildings. Ample parking accommodates several cars.

Bruichladdich Distillery is a 10-minute walk along the coastal cycle path, with swimming beaches equally accessible. Port Charlotte's family-friendly restaurants, pubs, and shops are 5 minutes by car or 45 minutes via the scenic cycle path. Bruichladdich village shop serves excellent coffee and sandwiches. Perfect for families seeking a quiet, safe Isle of Islay base for exploring beaches, distilleries, and coastal walks. Please note: Curlew Cottage is not pet-friendly.
directions: Take the coastal road to Port Charlotte. Drive past Bruichladdich Distillery, and turn right after about half a mile up a small lane on the crest with the sign, "Coultorsay". If you reach the War Memorial on the sea ward side of the road, you have gone too far!

children.text: The Isle of Islay is accessible by CalMac ferry from Kennacraig on the Kintyre Peninsula, with regular sailings to both Port Askaig and Port Ellen (both ports approximately 30 minutes' drive from Bruichladdich). The ferry crossing takes 2 hours and offers stunning views across the Sound of Islay. Vehicle reservations are essential and should be booked well in advance, especially during peak season and whisky festival periods.

Loganair operates daily flights from Glasgow to Islay Airport, with the flight taking just 40 minutes. The airport is approximately 20 minutes' drive from our Bruichladdich properties. Car hire is available at the airport and ferry ports, and is recommended for exploring the island at your own pace.

We recommend booking travel insurance for your journey, as ferry sailings can occasionally be affected by adverse weather conditions or technical issues in the winter months. For full travel information, ferry timetables, and booking details, please visit the CalMac website or contact us for local advice and recommendations.

children.text: Portbahn Islay offers three distinctive self-catering holiday homes in Bruichladdich on the Isle of Islay, Scotland. Situated along the shoreline of Loch Indaal on the Scottish Islands, our neighbouring properties sleep 6-8 guests each and provide the perfect base for exploring Islay's world-famous whisky distilleries, pristine beaches, and dramatic coastal landscapes.

Each property offers something unique: Portbahn House is our largest modern home sleeping 8, ideal for whisky enthusiasts and families with its large garden featuring trampoline and swings. Shorefield is an eco-house powered by wind and solar energy with private bird reserves, perfect for nature lovers and bird watchers. Curlew Cottage provides a safe, quiet retreat for families seeking peace and privacy, with a walled garden and private access road.

All three properties are within a 10-minute walk of Bruichladdich Distillery along the coastal cycle path, with swimming beaches, Port Charlotte's restaurants and shops, and the Islay Museum all easily accessible. Whether you're visiting for distillery tours, beach walks, wildlife watching, or simply to experience the tranquil beauty of the Inner Hebrides, our Bruichladdich homes offer comfortable, well-equipped accommodation for your Isle of Islay adventure.

children.text: Bruichladdich sits on the western shore of Loch Indaal on the Rhinns of Islay, perfectly positioned for exploring everything the Isle of Islay has to offer. The village is home to the famous Bruichladdich Distillery, where visitors can tour the working distillery and sample world-renowned single malt whisky and The Botanist gin. A scenic 10-minute walk along the coastal cycle path connects our properties directly to the distillery gates.

The coastal location provides immediate access to Portbahn Beach, one of Islay's hidden gems with three sheltered bays perfect for wild swimming, beachcombing, and coastal walks. The cycle path continues to Port Charlotte, just 5 minutes by car or 45 minutes on foot, where you'll find family-friendly restaurants, traditional Scottish pubs, local shops, and the fascinating Islay Museum documenting island life and history.

From Bruichladdich, all of Islay's nine whisky distilleries are within easy reach for touring. The island's renowned beaches - from Machir Bay to Saligo Bay - offer miles of golden sand and dramatic Atlantic surf. RSPB nature reserves provide exceptional bird watching opportunities, while the surrounding countryside is perfect for hiking and wildlife spotting. Bruichladdich's central west coast location makes it an ideal base for experiencing the very best of island life on the Isle of Islay.
